item.title: 美国银行监管机构考虑对 SVB 前高管采取法律行动
item.description: 美国一家主要银行监管机构的主席周二表示，该机构正在考虑对硅谷银行的六名前高管和十一名前董事采取法律行动。【原文：The chairman of a leading U.S. banking regulator said Tuesday his agency is considering legal action against six former officers and eleven former directors of Silicon Valley Bank.】

item.title: 消息称贝恩资本正在洽谈收购小凯撒运营商 Sizzling Platter
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周二表示，私募股权公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）正在洽谈以超过 10 亿美元（包括债务）的价格收购经营 Little Caesars 和 Jersey Mike's 等餐厅特许经营权的 Sizzling Platter 公司。【原文：Private equity firm Bain Capital is in talks to acquire Sizzling Platter, which operates restaurant franchises such as Little Caesars and Jersey Mike's, for more than $1 billion, including debt, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国贸易法庭认定联想智能手机侵犯爱立信专利
item.description: 美国国际贸易委员会周二表示，联想旗下摩托罗拉移动公司生产的智能手机侵犯了爱立信公司的专利，如果这一决定成立，将导致美国禁止进口这些手机。【原文：The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Tuesday that smartphones made by Lenovo's Motorola Mobility infringe patents owned by Ericsson , which could lead to a ban on U.S. imports of the phones if the decision is upheld.】

item.title: 美国企业承诺为特朗普就职典礼捐款
item.description: 从金融巨头到硅谷巨头，各种公司都承诺向唐纳德-特朗普的就职基金捐款，因为商界领袖们急于确保在 11 月大选获胜后与这位美国当选总统保持良好关系。【原文：Companies ranging from finance majors to Silicon Valley behemoths are pledging donations to Donald Trump's inaugural fund as business leaders rush to ensure a favorable relationship with the U.S. president-elect after his November election win.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 Insignia 拒绝贝恩 17 亿美元的收购计划
item.description: 澳大利亚 Insignia Financial 公司周三表示，已拒绝私募股权巨头贝恩资本（Bain Capital）的全现金收购要约，该要约对这家拥有 178 年历史的资金管理公司的估值为 26.7 亿澳元（16.9 亿美元）。【原文：Australia's Insignia Financial said on Wednesday it had rejected an all-cash takeover bid from private equity giant Bain Capital, which valued the 178-year-old money manager at A$2.67 billion ($1.69 billion).】

item.title: 早间竞价：央行热不断升温，削弱风险偏好
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 万事达卡将回购最多 120 亿美元股票
item.description: 万事达卡周二表示，董事会已批准一项新的股票回购计划，授权公司回购最多 120 亿美元的 A 类股票。【原文：Mastercard said on Tuesday that its board has approved a new share repurchase program, authorizing the company to buy back up to $12 billion of its Class A shares.】

item.title: 苹果公司称已通知供应商停止从刚果购买矿产品
item.description: 苹果公司周二表示，它强烈质疑有关其产品使用冲突矿产的指控，并在今年早些时候告知供应商停止从刚果民主共和国和卢旺达采购这些矿产。【原文：Apple on Tuesday said it strongly disputes allegations that it uses conflict minerals in its products and told suppliers earlier this year to stop purchasing those minerals from the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda.】

item.title: 优步及其首席执行官各向特朗普就职基金捐款 100 万美元
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）及其首席执行官达拉-科斯罗萨西（Dara Khosrowshahi）周二向路透社表示，公司向美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的就职基金各捐赠了 100 万美元。【原文：Uber Technologies and its CEO Dara Khosrowshahi each donated $1 million to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's inaugural fund, a company spokesperson told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: Arm和高通律师在芯片设计之争中拷问前苹果高管
item.description: 本周二，Arm 公司和高通公司的律师就芯片行业未来的一个关键问题询问了苹果公司的一位前高管：谁拥有建立在 Arm 计算架构之上的知识产权？【原文：Attorneys for Arm , and Qualcomm grilled a former Apple executive on Tuesday about a key question for the future of the chip industry: Who owns the intellectual property built on top of Arm's computing architecture?】

item.title: 新西兰商业委员会削减本地公司的维萨卡和万事达卡支付费用
item.description: 新西兰商业委员会周三发布了一项决定草案，降低当地企业接受威士卡和万事达卡支付的费用。【原文：New Zealand's Commerce Commission on Wednesday issued a draft decision to reduce the fees that local businesses pay to accept Visa and Mastercard payments.】

item.title: 监管机构称未来十年半数美国面临电力短缺高风险
item.description: 北美电力可靠性公司（North American Electric Reliability Corporation）周二表示，在未来十年中，美国约有一半地区的电力供应短缺风险增加，可能导致停电和电力保护措施。【原文：About half of the United States is at increased risk of power supply shortfalls in the next decade that could lead to outages and electricity conservation measures, the North American Electric Reliability Corporation said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国联邦计划在弗吉尼亚州建造世界上首个电网规模的聚变发电厂
item.description: 联邦聚变系统公司（Commonwealth Fusion Systems）是一家从麻省理工学院（Massachusetts Institute of Technology）分离出来的私营公司，该公司周二表示，它计划在弗吉尼亚州建造所谓的世界上第一座电网规模的聚变发电厂，到2030年代初进行发电。【原文：Commonwealth Fusion Systems, a private company spun off from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, plans what it calls the world's first grid-scale fusion power plant in Virginia, to generate power by the early 2030s, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据《纽约时报》报道，埃隆-马斯克和 SpaceX 在安全报告失误后面临联邦审查
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周二报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）和太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）面临至少三次联邦审查，审查内容涉及他们是否遵守了旨在保护国家安全的联邦报告规则。【原文：Elon Musk and SpaceX face at least three federal reviews over whether they have complied with federal reporting rules aimed at protecting national security, the New York Times reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 意大利 BPM 在联合信贷银行竞购后要求市场监督机构保护利益相关者
item.description: 意大利 BPM 银行周二表示，将要求市场监督机构 Consob 采取措施保护该银行的利益相关者及其对 Anima 的竞购，此前竞争对手意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）也发起了对 BPM 的竞购。【原文：Italy's Banco BPM said on Tuesday it would ask market watchdog Consob to adopt measures to protect the bank's stakeholders and its bid for Anima , after rival UniCredit launched its own bid for BPM.】

item.title: 派拉蒙 84 亿美元的 Skydance 合并案面临美国权利中心向联邦通信委员会提出的挑战
item.description: 本周二提交的一份文件显示，非营利性公益律师事务所美国权利中心（Center for American Rights）已向联邦通信委员会（FCC）提出申请，对派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）和天舞传媒公司（Skydance Media）计划斥资 84 亿美元进行的合并提出质疑。【原文：The Center for American Rights, a non-profit public-interest law firm, has petitioned the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to challenge the planned $8.4 billion merger between Paramount Global and Skydance Media, a filing showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Basis 为会计自动化 "代理 "融资 3400 万美元
item.description: 人工智能初创公司 Basis 周二表示，该公司在 A 轮融资中为其人工智能驱动的会计自动化产品筹集了 3400 万美元。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup Basis has raised $34 million in a Series A funding round for its AI-powered accounting automation product, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Tod's 创始人迭戈-德拉瓦莱与兄弟安德烈瓜分比亚乔股份
item.description: 奢侈鞋履制造商 Tod's 创始人的控股公司 Diego Della Valle & C Srl 已将其在比亚乔的股份转让给 Diego 和 Andrea Della Valle 兄弟。【原文：Diego Della Valle & C Srl, the holding company of the founder of luxury shoemaker Tod's, has transferred its stake in Piaggio to brothers Diego and Andrea Della Valle, a spokesperson for the Vespa maker said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Stellantis 计划如何振兴其意大利生产？
item.description: 汽车制造商 Stellantis 周二在与意大利工业部长阿道夫-乌尔索（Adolfo Urso）以及供应商和工会代表的会晤中宣布了一项振兴其在意大利产量的计划，为政府与菲亚特制造商 Stellantis 之间数月来的紧张关系划上了句号。【原文：Carmaker Stellantis on Tuesday announced a plan to revitalise its output in Italy during a meeting with Industry Minister Adolfo Urso and representatives of suppliers and trade unions, drawing a line under months of fraught relations between the government and Fiat-maker Stellantis.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国拨款法案将包括允许全年销售 E15 汽油的计划
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，即将出台的美国政府拨款法案预计将包括一项允许全年销售乙醇混合比例较高的汽油的计划，这对玉米和乙醇游说团体来说是一个重大胜利。【原文：An upcoming U.S. government funding bill is expected to include a plan that would allow year-round sales of gasoline with a higher ethanol blend, a major win for the corn and ethanol lobbies, according to two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 微策略公司进入纳斯达克 100 指数吸引了近 1100 万美元的散户资金流入
item.description: 本周一，散户投资者向微策略公司（MicroStrategy）的股票投入了近 1100 万美元，几乎是今年日均流入量的三倍，此前这家比特币最大的企业持有者在纳斯达克 100 指数中占据了一席之地。【原文：Retail investors poured nearly $11 million into MicroStrategy's shares on Monday, almost three times their average daily inflows this year, after the biggest corporate holder of bitcoin secured a spot in the Nasdaq-100 index.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，日本本田和日产将开始合并谈判
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周二报道，日本汽车巨头本田汽车和日产汽车将就合并事宜进行谈判，并将整合双方资源，以更好地与全球大型电动汽车制造商竞争。【原文：Japanese automobile giants Honda Motor and Nissan Motor will enter negotiations toward a merger and join their resources to better compete against larger electric vehicle makers globally, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 欧洲通信卫星组织宣布与空中客车公司签订 100 颗卫星合同
item.description: 法国卫星公司欧洲通信卫星组织（Eutelsat）已选择航空航天巨头空中客车公司（Airbus）为其 OneWeb 星座扩展建造 100 颗小型卫星，并将于 2026 年底左右开始交付。【原文：French satellite company Eutelsat has chosen aerospace giant Airbus to build 100 small satellites for its OneWeb constellation extension, with deliveries to begin around the end of 2026.】

item.title: Grubhub 因误导客户、餐馆和司机而支付 2500 万美元
item.description: 本周二，Grubhub 与美国联邦贸易委员会和伊利诺伊州总检察长 Kwame Raoul 达成和解，原因是 Grubhub 涉嫌在订单费用方面误导客户，未经客户同意在其平台上添加餐厅，并在薪酬方面欺骗司机。【原文：Grubhub settled with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission and Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul on Tuesday for allegedly misleading customers about order fees, adding restaurants to its platform without their consent and deceiving drivers about pay.】

item.title: 特斯拉斥责德国工会试图罢免劳资协议会负责人
item.description: 特斯拉指责德国 IG Metall 工会试图在这家电动汽车制造商位于柏林附近的千兆工厂制造动乱，并试图罢免工会主席，这是双方关系恶化的最新迹象。【原文：Tesla accused Germany's IG Metall union of trying to sow unrest at the EV maker's gigafactory near Berlin by seeking to oust the head of the works council, in the latest sign of the sour relationship between the two sides.】

item.title: 美国监管机构敲定太阳能电池板和房屋净值贷款新规
item.description: 美国消费者金融监管机构周二敲定了新的法规，该机构表示，新法规将保护通过房产税为太阳能电池板和其他采购提供资金的房屋装修借款人。【原文：The U.S. watchdog agency for consumer finance on Tuesday finalized new regulations it said would protect home improvement borrowers who finance solar panels and other purchases through their property taxes, the agency said.】

item.title: 星巴克员工工会授权在美国举行潜在罢工
item.description: 代表 10,000 多名星巴克咖啡师的工会表示，他们已授权在本周二与该咖啡巨头进行今年最后一轮谈判之前举行一次可能的罢工。【原文：The workers union representing more than 10,000 Starbucks baristas said they have authorized a potential strike, ahead of this year's final round of bargaining talks with the coffee giant on Tuesday.】

item.title: 拜登政府未能实现政府车队电动车目标 - 报告
item.description: 美国政府问责局周二发布的一份报告称，美国政府机构未能实现政府车队电动汽车采购目标。【原文：U.S. government agencies failed to meet government fleet electric vehicle purchase targets, a Government Accountability Office report released Tuesday said.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份商业库存勉强增长
item.description: 由于零售商和批发商库存的小幅增长被制造商库存的下降部分抵消，10 月份美国商业库存略有上升。【原文：U.S. business inventories edged up in October as modest increases in stocks at retailers and wholesalers were partially offset by a decline at manufacturers.】

item.title: 本田的目标是到 2030 年将混合动力汽车销量翻一番，作为通向电动汽车时代的 "桥梁"。
item.description: 日本汽车制造商本田汽车公司（Honda Motor）周三表示，该公司的目标是到2030年将其全球混合动力汽车年销量从2023年的水平翻一番，达到130万辆，为全电动汽车的普及提供 "桥梁"。【原文：Honda Motor aims to double its global hybrid car sales to 1.3 million vehicles annually by 2030 from 2023 levels, providing a "bridge" until fully electric vehicles become more widespread, the Japanese automaker said on Wednesday.】
